Welcome Back! Ready to manage your meters? Ready to manage your meters? QR Meter Management System ‚Ä¢ Match meters with existing data records\n‚Ä¢ Scan QR codes to register new meters\n‚Ä¢ Manage meter locations and assignments\n‚Ä¢ Export and upload meter data files ‚Ä¢ Match meters with existing data records\n‚Ä¢ Scan QR codes to register new meters\n‚Ä¢ Manage meter locations and assignments\n‚Ä¢ Export and upload meter data files Quick Statistics Manage

Continue Edit
Now let me create the additional string resources that we need for the enhanced UI:
Perfect! I've successfully updated the DetectedFragment to include the new enhanced UI/UX flow while preserving all existing functionality. Here's a summary of what I've implemented: ‚úÖ Enhanced DetectedFragment Features: üîÑ Dual Flow System:
Enhanced UI: Used for METER_CHECK context with the new 3-step flow Legacy UI: Preserves all existing functionality for backward compatibility Smart Detection: Automatically chooses the appropriate UI based on context
üì± New Enhanced Flow States:
PROCESSING: Shows loading state while detecting meter NEEDS_METER_DATA: Missing location/number - shows ‚ö†Ô∏è warnings and "Set Meter Data" button READY_FOR_SN_CHECK: All data complete - shows ‚úÖ checkmarks and "Check S/N" button SN_VERIFIED: Verification complete - shows all ‚úÖ and "Back" button ERROR: Error handling with appropriate messaging
üé® Enhanced Visual Elements:
Dynamic status icons: ‚úÖ checkmarks for complete, ‚ö†Ô∏è warnings for missing Smart button text: Changes based on current state Color-coded feedback: Green for success, orange for warnings, red for errors Real-time status updates: Visual feedback for location, number, and serial verification
üîß Preserved Legacy Functionality:
All existing methods: updateMeterCheckedByStatus, parseSerialNumber, showSuccessResult, etc. Dialog systems: Existing meter setup dialogs and location spinners Database operations: All existing meter CRUD operations Navigation: Existing navigation patterns maintained Error handling: All existing error handling preserved
üîó Integration Points:
MeterDataInputFragment: New dialog for setting meter data LocationFragment: Navigation for adding locations FilesViewModel: Uses existing methods like updateMeterCheckedStatusBySerialAsync LocationRepository: Integrates with existing location management
üìÑ Files Created/Updated:
DetectedFragment.kt - Enhanced with new flow while preserving legacy fragment_detected.xml - Updated layout with new status indicators MeterDataInputFragment.kt - New dialog for meter data input fragment_meter_data_input.xml - Layout for data input dialog strings.xml - Additional string resources for new features mobile_navigation.xml - New navigation actions Drawable resources - Icons for status indicators
üéØ Flow Implementation:
Step 1: Successfully Detected
Shows meter detection with enhancement indicators Missing data shows ‚ö†Ô∏è exclamation marks Button reads "Set Meter Data" Checks for locations and prompts to add if none exist
Step 2: Complete Data + Serial Match
All indicators show ‚úÖ checkmarks Button changes to "Check S/N" Updates registered = true in database Button becomes "Back" after verification
Step 3: Incomplete Data Recovery
Opens MeterDataInputFragment for missing data After input, returns to DetectedFragment Exclamation marks change to checkmarks Proceeds to Step 2 automatically
The implementation maintains full backward compatibility while providing the enhanced UX you requested. The existing functionality for updateMeterCheckedByStatus and other critical methods remains unchanged and functional.

üìã Instructions:\n\n1. Upload a CSV file with the following required columns:\n ‚Ä¢ Number - Meter identification number\n ‚Ä¢ SerialNumber - Unique serial number\n ‚Ä¢ Place - Location/address of the meter\n ‚Ä¢ Registered - Boolean (true/false, yes/no, 1/0)\n\n2. After upload, choose processing destination:\n ‚Ä¢ MeterCheck - For meter verification workflow\n ‚Ä¢ Match - For matching operations\n\n3. Only valid CSV files can be processed\n\nSupported file types: CSV, TXT\nMaximum file size: 10MB

üìã CSV Format Requirements:\n\nRequired Column:\n‚Ä¢ SerialNumber - Unique serial number (e.g., SN123456789, 2203312)\n\nExample CSV Content:\nSerialNumber\n2203312\nSN987654321\nMTR-001-ABC\n\nNotes:\n‚Ä¢ Header row is required\n‚Ä¢ Comma-separated values\n‚Ä¢ Text containing commas should be quoted\n‚Ä¢ Empty lines are ignored\n‚Ä¢ Invalid lines are skipped with warnings

üìã Instructions:\n\n1. Upload a CSV file with the following required column:\n ‚Ä¢ SerialNumber - Unique serial number identifier\n\n2. After upload, choose processing destination:\n ‚Ä¢ MeterCheck - For serial number verification workflow\n ‚Ä¢ Match - For matching operations\n\n3. Only valid CSV files can be processed\n\nSupported file types: CSV, TXT\nMaximum file size: 10MB\n\nExample CSV format:\nSerialNumber\nSN123456789\n2203312\nMTR-001-ABC
